NotFoundPage.title: Page Not Found
NotFoundPage.description: Oops! It seems like you've stumbled upon a page that doesn't exist. Don't worry, our internationalization magic is still hard at work on other parts of the app. Feel free to navigate back to explore more!

About.train_travel_tip_1: If you're traveling in Vietnam, it's a good idea to learn some basic Vietnamese phrases. Not only will it help you navigate the train stations, but locals will appreciate the effort.
About.train_travel_tip_2: Start enjoying the scenic views as soon as you board your train. If you're on a night train, relax and enjoy the peaceful journey through Vietnam’s landscapes.
About.train_travel_tip_3: Taking the train is an eco-friendly mode of transport. Trains offer a chance to see Vietnam’s beautiful countryside, with views that can’t be matched by flying.
About.train_travel_tip_4: Make sure to pack snacks and drinks, especially on long train journeys. Vietnam’s train stations often offer local food, so try some Vietnamese specialties along the way!
About.train_origin: The first trains in Vietnam were introduced by the French colonialists in the late 19th century. The first railway line connected Hanoi and Hai Phong.
About.daily_train_departures: There are hundreds of train departures daily across Vietnam, connecting major cities and remote regions.
About.supertrain: Vietnam is known for its sleeper trains, which provide a comfortable way to travel long distances overnight, but unlike high-speed trains, they are not the fastest mode of travel.
